Room.Name: The End of the Wharf
Room.Description: This is the northernmost point of the wharf, where it buts up against the stone wall of a warehouse. A door to another warehouse lies to the east, and the wharf is packed with ships to the west.

Exit.Description: You see the door to a warehouse.
You see the rest of the wharf.

Room.Name: The Wharf
Room.Description: The wharf is a very busy place, with sailors, passengers, and dock workers competing for space in this crowded place. The dock continues to the north and south. A warehouse lies to the east.

Exit.Description: You see the end of the wharf.

Room.Name: The Wharf
Room.Description: This long strip of sturdy wooden planking bravely faces the tormented Dragon Sea. Sailors bustle about on their duties and the smell of the salty sea fills you to the very core. The rest of the town is to the east.

Room.Name: The Wharf
Room.Description: This stretch of wooden planks is lined with ships from all over Orthos. Spice ships from New Thalos, weapons from Tar Valon, pipeweed bread from the Shire, and other treats from every port of call arrive here in the gloomy city of Arkham.

Exit.Description: You see the end of the wharf.
You see the tempestuous Dragon Sea.

Room.Name: The End of the Wharf
Room.Description: This is the southernmost point of the wharf. Ships are constantly arriving and departing to all parts of the world. Some of the new arrivals are foolish enough to step into the Wharfside Bar. The rest of the wharf lies north, and the Dragon Sea is to the west.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: This grim street is full of people arriving and departing from Arkham. The wharf lies to the west and Main Street continues to the east. A chartmaker's shop is to the south.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: This foggy lane leads east and west. The grim inhabitants of Arkham pace one end of it to the other on various errands and matters of business. Eldritch Lane wends its crooked way to the north and a snug alley lies dead south.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: This street seems to be a bit lively. This part of town is a warrior's dream, with a mercenary employment office to the north and a weaponsmith to the south.

Exit.Description: You see the Mercenary Employment office.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: You casually stroll down the main thoroughfare of Arkham, which is filled with shops of all kinds and homes with steep roofs and broad porches. A cobbler's lies to the north and a large house sits silent to the south.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: Before you stands a titantic cathedral of smooth, solid grey stone. Its gothic peaks tower over all other structures in the city. Stained glass windows depicting the deeds of the Elder Gods shine brilliantly in the sun. The doorway lies to the south.

Room.Name: Town Square
Room.Description: This is the intersection between Main Street and Dragon's Road. Pale citizens mill about a large statue of a warrior standing victoriously over a slain dragon. Main Street leads east and west and Dragon's Road runs north and south. A large cathedral stands to the southeast.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: You stand south of the city hall building, who's entrance lies on Dragon's Road. Main Street continues east and west.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: Several colorful and busy shops lie on this part of Main street. To the north is Candi's Confections, and a sign points south to the Potter's Guild Shop.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: The lanterns of the Bullhorn Inn shine from the north here as travellers arrive from all parts of the realm, seeking a haven from the nightmarish weather. To the south runs a smooth brick wall, and Main Street continues to the east and west.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: Main Street abruptly ends here at the base of a wall. It the mortar joining the bricks seems fresh, as if something were being walled out. It leads to the west, and Ipswich Row runs to the north and south.

Room.Name: Library
Room.Description: This is the university's library. You nose is filled with the smell of ancient parchment. Tall, long shelves of ancient, arcane manuscripts are surrounded by sturdy oak reading desks. The door to the rest of the university is west.

Room.Name: Alley
Room.Description: Rats run into their holes and cats hiss at you from atop piles of garbage as you meander through rubble and the soot-filled air. To the south the alley is a dead end.

Room.Name: Dead End
Room.Description: The alley dead ends here. You notice that the smell of the trash has gotten intolerable. You also notice that the rats aren't quite as scared...

Room.Name: Harbor
Room.Description: This is a small harbor. Arkham's wharves stand to the east. The Dragon Sea lies colds and grey to the west.

Room.Name: Eldritch Lane
Room.Description: The loose cobblestones lead you into the darkest corners of this very dark city. The houses here are more crowded and ancient, and all is covered with a thick veneer of grime and dust. This road continues to the north, and Main Street is directly to the south.

Room.Name: Eldritch Lane
Room.Description: The grime and grease of this place seem to be permane ntly embedded in your skin as you traverse the crowded avenues. The foul odor of rotting garbage floats down from the north. To the east is Patch's Tavern, and a sign on a dusty storefront reads "Antiques Etc."

Room.Name: Eldritch Lane
Room.Description: The old high-gabled houses seem to become more and more crowded as the street gets more narrow. Dark men tudge down the avenue, pained expressions in their eyes signal that all is not well here. A large mansion stands to the west.

Room.Name: Eldritch Lane
Room.Description: You dare not stray from the streets, lest you find yourself consumed by the hordes of rats that must surely be lurking in the alleys. Old crones duck back behind tattered curtains as you meet their gaze. Eldritch lane continues east and west.

Exit.Description: An old tenament house stands here.

Room.Name: Eldritch Lane
Room.Description: This slim grimey avenue runs right past the Arkham Asylum for the Criminally Insane, which lies to the north. People hobble past fervently avoiding looking at the creatures staring back at them from the barred windows. No wonder this part of the street is empty.

Room.Name: Harbor
Room.Description: This is a small harbor, dotted with small fishing craft and large trading vessels. Arkham's wharves stand to the east. The Dragon Sea lies colds and grey to the west.

Room.Name: Dragon Road
Room.Description: This road ends at a giant iron gate, which seems rusty from disuse. Dragon road leads to the north and to the east Corrine Way stretches past some houses. An awful stench comes from behind the gates.

Exit.Description: You see Corrine Way and a large number of homes.

Room.Name: Dragon Road
Room.Description: You stand to the east of a massive cathedral of grey stone with large spires and beautiful stained glass windows. To the north is an intersection and Dragon Road continues south.

Room.Name: Dragon Road
Room.Description: You walk down a densely cobbled street sandwiched between two brick walls. To the east is the impressive City Hall building and to the east stand the stables.

Exit.Description: You see an intersection of two busy streets.

Room.Name: Dragon Road
Room.Description: This is the juncture between Dragon's Road, Eldritch Lane to the west, and Arcanus Avenue to the east which is reflected in the variety of people milling about here.

Room.Name: Dragon Road
Room.Description: The number of people are starting to diminish as the road leads out of town. To your sides are the giant iron city gates, which are open. You see a large, untamed forest to the north.

Room.Name: Dragon Road
Room.Description: The trees are moderately thick here, though the stench of Arkham wafts faintly from the south. To the north the forest grows thicker, and to the east a castle is under construction.

Exit.Description: You see a road through the forest.
You see the city of Arkham.
You see a castle being built.

Room.Name: Corrine Way
Room.Description: You are on the road in the middle of a pleasant if somewhat plain residential area. Two houses stand out from the rest to the north and south, and Corrine Way continues east and west.

Room.Name: Corrine Way
Room.Description: You are on the road in the middle of a pleasant if somewhat plain residential area. Two houses stand out from the rest to the north and south, and Corrine Way continues east and west.

Room.Name: Ipswich Row
Room.Description: You stand at the southern end of Ipswich Row, in a small area full of quiet homes and tidy flower gardens. You see a number of houses to the west along Corrine Way, and Ipswich Row continues north.

Room.Name: Ipswich Row
Room.Description: This long, narrow, straight road is moderately full of people, who are on their way to work or on other errands. Few are out here to enjoy Arkham's dismal weather. An intersection lies to the north and Ipswich Row continues to the south.

Room.Name: Castle Grounds
Room.Description: You walk through the construction site for a castle, barely dodging out of the way of a running errand boy and ducking just in time to avoid getting swatted by a swinging plank. Dragon's Road lies east of here.

Room.Name: Ipswich Row
Room.Description: This long, narrow, straight road is moderately full of people, who are on their way to work or on other errands. Few are out here to enjoy Arkham's dismal weather. Ipswi ch row continues to the north and Main Street lies to the south.

Room.Name: Ipswich Row
Room.Description: You stand at the northern end of Ipswich Row, in a small area full of large homes and arcane shops. You see Miskatonic University to the west along Arcanus Avenue, and Ipswich Row continues south.

Room.Name: Arcanus Avenue
Room.Description: You walk along a broad avenue full of rich merchants, mages, professors, and the occasional student dashing off to classes at Miskatonic University which lies to the north. The old but well-kept store to the south is called the Magic Moon.

Room.Name: Arcanus Avenue
Room.Description: Along this road one can find anything magical or beautiful, but they'll also find a hefty price tag to accompany it. To the south stands a large, elegant mansion, full of rich treasures. An alchemist's shop lies to the north on this road, which continues east. Dragon's Road lies to the west.

Exit.Description: You see a mansion with a well-kept lawn.

Room.Name: Harbor
Room.Description: This is a small harbor. Arkham's wharves stand to the east. The Dragon Sea lies colds and grey to the west.

Room.Name: Warehouse
Room.Description: Other than the rat scurrying past your feet, the warehouse looks abandoned. You see a door to the west that leads you out of here.

Room.Name: Warehouse
Room.Description: Boxes and crates fill almost all of the space from floor to ceiling. You hear the occasional rat scratching behind a wall or from inside a crate. A door leads west out of here.

Room.Name: Chartmakers
Room.Description: Large maps and charts are plastered all over the walls or lie strewn about or rolled up into canisters. A large map of the entire world is framed on the southern wall. The exit is north.

Room.Name: Wharfside Bar
Room.Description: This rowdy, crowded dive is popular with the sailors. The dank smells of tobacco and cheap beer assail your nose, while the cretins that inhabit this bar look you over. If you aren't careful, you could wake up on the next ship out of here. The exit is west.

Room.Name: Antiques Etc.
Room.Description: This dusty store is filled with varied and strange items, scattered or casually tossed into piles. The proprietor seems just as disheveled as his merchandise. The door out of here is east.

Room.Name: Abandoned Mansion
Room.Description: Many fallen timbers lay amid broken furniture and musty tapestries in this once-fine home. Though most of the wood here is worm-eaten and rotting, a pair of useable stone stairs lead up into the darkness. A door outside lies east.

Room.Name: Tenament House
Room.Description: You are inside a filthy apartment building. Roaches scurry past you feet, chased by a greasy fat lady with a broom. Most of the doors look well-locked here and the exit is south.

Room.Name: Patch's Tavern
Room.Description: This filthy excuse for a watering hole is full of dark, grinning, evil looking men and women. You notice a few people casually walking in and out of a door to the east. Rough wooden tables are surrounded by all manner of strange people, some of whom are absorbed in their card games or their drinking, others are planning thier next great criminal enterprise. An exit is to the west.

Room.Name: Black Market
Room.Description: A number of people who look suspiciously like rogues stand about, haggling with a wiry man with wild hair. The shelves are filled with a vast assortm ent of valuables. A small door leads out of here to the west.

Room.Name: Mercenary's Guild
Room.Description: This hall is bustling with men and women busily bouting, exercising, or polishing their weapons. A large desk occupied by a thin, balding man with glasses has lists of mercenaries that are currenty offering their services.

Room.Name: Mercenary's Quarters
Room.Description: Large bunks line the walls of this damp chamber.

Room.Name: Cobbler's
Room.Description: The smell of leather is thick in this shop. Shoes in various stages of completion litter the tables and walls, while large strips of leather hang down from the ceiling. The exit is south.

Room.Name: Stables
Room.Description: These stinky stalls are inhabited by horses from many lands, who's masters are visiting Arkham. While they cannot yet sell horses here, they do offer to let you sleep in the hay if you cannot find a place to stay in town. A large exit leads east.

Room.Name: Large House
Room.Description: This house is well kept and clean. Weapons and momentos of war are mounted on the walls or rest on shelves. This must be the home of a successful mercenary. If he were home, you'd probably be dead now. A door leading out lies north.

Room.Name: Cathedral of the Elder Gods
Room.Description: This high-ceilinged gothic cathedral is cavernous. Murals and stained glass windows depict the deeds of the Elder Gods in times past. This cathedral also houses a monestary, which lies west. A chapel is to the south, and a stone stairway rises up to a loft.

Room.Name: Room
Room.Description: This is a small but comfortable room. A pitcher rests by a chamberpot next to the cozy looking bed. A fireplace blazes on the north wall. You feel safe here, and a door leads back south when you're ready to face the world again.

Room.Name: House
Room.Description: You are inside a stately home full of guilded furnishings and thick plush carpeting. Ancient vases and fine textiles make this feel more like a museum than a real home. An oaken door leads back outside to the north.

Room.Name: City Hall
Room.Description: This fine stone building stands firm and strong. Inside, rooms lead to different departments of the city government. You notice a large amount of guards coming and going on unknown missions. Double doors lead west.

Room.Name: Candi's Confections
Room.Description: The sweet warmth of baking cookies fills the room. Cookies and candy of every kind are made here, and you cannot help but feel a little tempted.

Room.Name: Bullhorn Inn
Room.Description: Two bullhorns mounted on a plaque are the namesake of this quiet, decent inn. Round tables for dining and the innkeeper's bar fill this part of the inn. A small room is available to the north, and the exit back to town is to the south.

Exit.Description: You see a small, cozy room.

Room.Name: Magic Moon
Room.Description: You see magic items of all sorts in this shop. Prized magic wands sit under glass and amulets and charms lie ready to be purchased.

Room.Name: Alchemist
Room.Description: Potions in bottles, cures in glass vials, all manner of magic liquids are sold in this tiny shop. Several cauldruns are boiling in back, and seem to attract all of the proprietor's attention. The exit is south.

Room.Name: Miskatonic University
Room.Description: This university specializes in the arcane and mysterious. Grey-robed professors walk solemnly past while students sit around and study ancient texts. A lecture hall is to the north, the library is east, and Arcanus Avenue lies to the south.

Room.Name: Dead End
Room.Description: This is a dead end in the corridor. On the east wall some runes have been carved into the black stone.

ExtraDescription.Description: Three together to the outer planes. One leads to the giant, One leads to the goat with a thousand young, And the last leads to the home of the Elder Ones. Three keys in three patriarch's hands, But beware! Choosing wrongly will lead to your demise.

Room.Name: House
Room.Description: You are in an old, small, but nice house. There is little else of note about it.

Room.Name: House
Room.Description: You are in an old, small, but nice house. There is little else of note about it.

Room.Name: Intersection
Room.Description: This is the intersection of four corridors. The walls are constructed of rough, large black blocks. A stairway made of the same material as the walls leads up to a horizontal door.

Exit.Description: You see an altar, from the bottom.

Room.Name: House
Room.Description: You are in an old, small, but nice house. There is little else of note about it.

Room.Name: House
Room.Description: You are in an old, small, but nice house. There is little else of note about it.

Room.Name: Laboratory
Room.Description: You are in a large laboratory full of bottled body parts and crude wires and glass bulbs. Atop a long wooden table human body assembled from the bodies of a number of different people. A stairway down is the only exit.

Room.Name: Chapel
Room.Description: This chapel is where most of the worship ceremonies are carried out. Rows of pews lie on either side of a red-carpeted walkway which leads up to an altar of solid silver. A corridor leads north to the rest of the cathedral A silver reliquary is behind a silver gate to the south.

Exit.Description: You see the main cathedral chamber.
You see a stairway made of black stone.

ExtraDescription.Description: You examine the altar and notice that it is cracked open a bit. Moving the lid aside, you see nothing inside bu t a handle, like the kind used for a door. It seems to lead downward.

Room.Name: Cell
Room.Description: By the kind of clothes that lie neatly folded here, you guess that this cell belongs to a nun. Bet she wouldn't appreciate you snooping through her stuff.

Room.Name: Cell
Room.Description: By the kind of clothes that lie neatly folded here, you guess that this cell belongs to a nun. Bet she wouldn't appreciate you snooping through her stuff.

Room.Name: Cell
Room.Description: By the kind of clothes that lie neatly folded here, you guess that this cell belongs to a monk. Bet he wouldn't appreciate you snooping through his stuff.

Room.Name: Cell
Room.Description: By the kind of clothes that lie neatly folded here, you guess that this cell belongs to a monk. Bet he wouldn't appreciate you snooping through his stuff.

Room.Name: Hallway
Room.Description: This hall of silvery grey stone is flanked by sturdy, rough oak doors. Another door marked "Dining Hall" leads west, and the hallway continues east.

Room.Name: Hallway
Room.Description: This hall of silvery grey stone is flanked by sturdy, rough oak doors. An open door leads east to the cathedral proper, and the hallway continues west.

Exit.Description: You see the main cathedral chamber.

Room.Name: Sepulchure
Room.Description: This room is bare save for a clear glass coffin in a silver frame, inside of which is the mummified remains of a saint in rich garb. A corridor leads east.

Room.Name: Dining Hall
Room.Description: Two long oak tables lie parallel to each other, surrounded by crude oak chairs. Along the west wall is a finer table, with three silver chairs along its west side. A door leads east to a hallway, and corridor north leads to the kitchen.

Room.Name: Kitchen
Room.Description: A large oven dominates the north wall. Cupboards surround the two flanking walls, and are filled with numerous meats, breads, and cheeses. The only exit is south back to the dining hall.

Room.Name: Abbot's Chamber
Room.Description: This simple yet tastefully decorated chamber is the abbot's living and working quarters. A large mahogany desk, cluttered with papers, sits in the middle of the room.

Room.Name: Priest's Chamber
Room.Description: This lavish chamber belongs to the high priest, who assists in the ceremonies to the Elder Gods. It seems messy and decorated in a bizzare manner. Large red drapes hang down from the walls and strange tomes scribed in blood fill the room. A door leads east to a hallway.

Room.Name: Priestess' Chamber
Room.Description: This chamber is decorated almost completely in silver. Silver curtains, silver candlesticks, and a small silver desk shine in the sunlight. You hear whispers in the halls that she has gone to slay the vampire that has been plaguing the city. A door leads west to the hallway.

Room.Name: Reliquary
Room.Description: A silver gate protects a number of religious artifacts. You see a number of holy books, chalices, and talismans. A silver gate leads north to the chapel.

Room.Name: Hallway
Room.Description: You stand in a hall of silvery grey stone. Three pine doors inlaid with silver stand to the north, east, and west. The hall leads south.

Room.Name: Landing
Room.Description: You stand above the cathedral floor, which you can see over the wooden rails to the west. A hallw ay leads north and south, and stairs lead down.

Exit.Description: You see a hallway and several doors.
You see a hallway and some stairs.

Room.Name: Bell Tower
Room.Description: You hear birds chirping above you and you look up and see a titanic silver bell. Rickety wooden stairs lead up and a landing stands to the north.

Exit.Description: You see a large silver bell.

Room.Name: Bell Tower
Room.Description: You are at the top of the bell tower, next to a silver bell as tall as two tall men, from which hands a thick rope. You can see far from here, and you can make out New Thalos in the distance across the Dragon Sea. Rickety stairs lead back to the second floor.

Exit.Description: You see the base of the bell tower.

Room.Name: Lecture Hall
Room.Description: Numerous rows of desks rise steeply from a lecturers podium. The ceiling is curved in a strange manner to help broadcast the lecturers voice to the upper levels of the hall. A set of double doors lead south.

Exit.Description: You see the main part of the campus.

Room.Name: Potter's Guild Store
Room.Description: This is where some of the finest potters in Arkham sell their masterpieces. The shelves are lined with pots, cups, urns, and other utensils. A door out is north.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here. The corridor seems to turn a corner here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Exit.Description: You see a tomb of some sort.

Room.Name: Sepulchure
Room.Description: This room is bare save for a clear glass coffin in a silver frame, inside of which is the mummifie d remains of a saint in rich garb. A corridor leads east.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here. The corridor seems to turn a corner here.

Room.Name: Dead End
Room.Description: The black-flagged corridor comes to an end here. You can turn back and go east.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Exit.Description: You see a corridor and some stairs.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Burial Chamber
Room.Description: The walls in this room are lined with racks of well-polished skulls, which once belonged to monks and nuns from the monastery above. Passages lead in all directions.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks . It is frighteningly dark in here. The corridor seems to turn a corner here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here. The corridor seems to turn a corner here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here. The corridor seems to turn a corner here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here. The corridor runs north and south, and branches off to the west.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here. The corridor seems to turn a corner here.

Room.Name: Dead End
Room.Description: The black-flagged corridor comes to an end here. You can turn back and go west.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Sepulchure
Room.Description: This room is bare save for a clear glass coffin in a silver frame, inside of which is the mummified remains of a saint in rich garb. A corridor leads east.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here.

Room.Name: Corridor
Room.Description: This corridor is composed of large black crudely cut blocks. It is frighteningly dark in here. The corridor seems to turn a corner here.

Exit.Description: You see a chamber with three doors.

Room.Name: Portal Chamber
Room.Description: Three solid silver doors glow faintly in the darkness here. The north door is engraved with a large silver star. The west door's markings have been chiseled out, and the east door bears the engraving of a monstrous octopoid creature.

Room.Name: Ritual Hall
Room.Description: Dark red tapestries hang over the walls. A large obsidian altar stands at the back of the room, atop which is a large green book. Hollow chants echo though the walls, and above this chamber a small portal has begun to form. A door lies east.

Exit.Description: You see a room with a number of doors.

ExtraDescription.Description: The portal begins to dematerialize since the ceremony was disturbed.
This is a copy of the infamous Necronomicon.
The altar is carved from a smooth block of obsidian.

Room.Name: Cthulhu's Lair
Room.Description: The ancient evil beast Cthulhu has been imprisoned in this completely black room. A large circle of stones surround the great creature, keeping it imprisoned for all time...until they are disturbed, that is. A door leads we st.

Exit.Description: You see a hall with many doors.

ExtraDescription.Description: These greenish grey stones are embedded with the silver star of the Elder Gods.

Room.Name: Elder God's Chamber
Room.Description: This silver-walled room is full of unusual objects and numerous scrolls. This is where the Elder Gods reside when they visit this plane, and they do not like to be disturbed. A door leads south.

Exit.Description: You see a hall with numerous doors.

Room.Name: Arkham Asylum
Room.Description: The rough brown walls of this hall lead to different cell blocks, each containing a large assortment of disturbed, deranged, and dangerous individuals. However, one can imagine that the guards here are more deranged than the inmates.

Room.Name: Cell
Room.Description: A little light streams through the barred windows in this cramped room. Rusty chains clamped to the wall wait to hold the more violent prisoners. A barred door leads out of this filthy chamber.

Exit.Description: You see the entrance to the asylum.

Room.Name: Cell
Room.Description: A little light streams through the barred windows in this cramped room. Rusty chains clamped to the wall wait to hold the more violent prisoners. A barred door leads out of this filthy chamber.

Exit.Description: You see the entrance to the asylum.

Room.Name: Blacksmith
Room.Description: The owner of this fine shop is busily making some of the finest weapons in the land. This shop supplies the Arkham Guard with its special armor and weapons, but it also deals with the general public. The door out of here is north.

Room.Name: Forest Road
Room.Description: Trees spring up around this hard-packed dirt trail, and their overhanging branches shade you from the worst of the sun's rays. North and south of you is more forest.

Room.Name: Forest Road
Room.Description: The road continues as a dirt trail, but the trees are a little less dense, and warm sunlight bleeds through the branches. The road continues north and sou th, and to the west you can make out a field of warm yellow corn.

Exit.Description: You see a large field of corn.

Room.Name: A Corn Field
Room.Description: You stand before a large field of ripe corn. However, no farm hands are there to pick this year's crop, no able hands to shuck the tender corn. But there are rats. And the rats are his.

Exit.Description: You see a road wending through a dense forest.

Room.Name: A Corn Field
Room.Description: Forest borders the south and west sides of the field here. Tall green corn stalks shoot up into the sky above your head. Despite the large rodent and crow population, you are alone.

Room.Name: A Corn Field
Room.Description: The corn is tall and brilliant green, though the rodents have taken their toll on the crop. You can see a dense forest to the south, and the field continues to the north, east, and west.

Room.Name: A Corn Field
Room.Description: The corn springs forth from the ground in neat, even rows. Rats and other rodents scurry past your feet, but do not dampen the sweet smells of ripening corn. the field is bordered to the north and east by trees, and continues to the south and west.

Room.Name: A Corn Field
Room.Description: The corn is tall and brilliant green, though the rodents have taken their toll on the crop. You can see a dense forest to the west, and the field continues to the north, east, and south.

Room.Name: A Corn Field
Room.Description: The rows of corn are thick here, and you struggle to push your way through the dense green leaves and unyielding stalks. You see nothing but corn in all directions except east, where a large forest stands.

Room.Name: A Corn Field
Room.Description: Forest borders the west side of the field here. Tall green corn stalks shoot up into the sky above your head. Despite the large rodent and crow population, you are alone...or so it seems. You see a small wooden dwelling to the north.

Exit.Description: You see the front yard of a farmhouse.

Room.Name: Front Yard
Room.Description: You are standing in front of a dilapidated peasant's home. The yard itself is overgrown with weeds, and if it were not for the smell of cooked food coming from the house to the north, you would think the place was abandoned. The fields lie back to the south.

Exit.Description: You see inside of the farmhouse.

Room.Name: Farm House
Room.Description: The air here is rich with the smells of warm food and cool cider. The funiture is ancient, some of it is broken beyond repair, but this place feels like a comfortable home nonetheless. The door leads back south to the corn fields.

Room.Name: Forest Road
Room.Description: The trees hang low over the road, and are quite dense. However, you can barely make out a farmhouse and a cornfield to the southwest, and this road continues north and south.

Exit.Description: You see a long road stretching through the forest.
You see a road winding through the forest.

Room.Name: Forest Road
Room.Description: Trees spring up around this hard-packed dirt trail, and their overhanging branches shade you from the worst of the sun's rays. North and south of you is more forest.

Room.Name: Forest Road
Room.Description: Bird songs and the fleeting rustle of bushes greet you as the trees seem to close in on you more and more. The road can hardly be called a road- it is a bare thin strip of dirt mosty overgrown with grass. The road continues north and south, and a tiny trail leads east.

Room.Name: A Trail
Room.Description: Trees spring up around this hard-packed dirt trail, and though it is tiny it seems to have been traveled recently. North and south of you is more forest, with its narrow trail the only sign of human life.

Exit.Description: A tiny trail leads through the forest.

Room.Name: A Trail
Room.Description: You find yourself deep in the middle of a very deep and dark forest. The only indication of a human presence seems to be an ancient tower to the east, but by the looks of it, it must have been abandoned long ago.

Exit.Description: You see a trail in the forest.

Room.Name: The Tower
Room.Description: You stand before a the crumbling remains of a stone tower. A number of the stones are missing, and all the rest of it is covered in ivy. However, you see a faint light though one of the windows near the top of the tower. The trail continues to the west and south, and a battered wooden door guards the tower to the north.

Room.Name: A Trail
Room.Description: The trail curves around here, heading north and east. To the north you see a crumbling tower, while to the east there is only more forest.

Room.Name: A Trail
Room.Description: The hard dirt lies straight and smooth under your feet. However, to the east the forest seems to have taken over the trail. Here it is still calm and the birds overhead sing sweet songs of joy.

Exit.Description: You see a wildly overgrown trail.

Room.Name: A Trail
Room.Description: The trail here is wildly overgrown with all sorts of vegetation. It seems to have done so unnaturally, however. Maybe this is someone's polite way of telling you to keep out... The trail leads west and south.

Exit.Description: You see a clearing in the woods.

Room.Name: A Clearing
Room.Description: A large grassy circle lies here at the end of the trail. Standing in the clea ring is a circle of large stones about the hight of a man about fifty feet in diameter. A large slab lies flat at the center of the circle. A thin trail leads north through a thick span of woods.

Exit.Description: You pull back the stone and see a dark cavern.

Room.Name: The Wyrm's Lair
Room.Description: This cavern is foul and dank with the smell of centuries-old excement. Roots hang down from the ceiling and earthworms and large beetles crawl through the bare soil. A hole up above is the only escape from this dark, hellish chamber.

Exit.Description: You see a clearing surrounding a circle of stones.

Room.Name: Forest Road
Room.Description: The forest is incredibly dark, and even in midday only bare specks of light may shine through. At night, the trees seem almost animated, stark against the pale moon light. The scent of death flows thick from the north.

Room.Name: A Ruined Village
Room.Description: The forest falls back a little, revealing abandoned buildings and streets littered with rotting corpses. Peeking in some of the homes, you can see that a great many of them have been plundered. To the north lies the rest of the village, and south of here is the road back to Arkham.

Exit.Description: You see the rest of the village.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: A fierce wind sweeps through the barren streets, which are congested with the dead and dying. Houses sit silent, with their curtains drawn, while the rats take the best of the baker's wares. You do notice two buildings that seem distict from the rest, which lie to the west and east.

Exit.Description: You see the main street of the plague-ridden city.

Room.Name: Baker's
Room.Description: The large stone ovens rest as cold as the flesh of the dead in this very dead village. What the rats haven't taken of the bread is slowly mouldering in the muggy heat. A wooden doo r leads back outside to the east.

Room.Name: A House
Room.Description: The stench of death clings to this dark house. The little light that peeks through the dark curtains falls on some crude furniture and rotting bodies. A small door leads west back onto the street.

Room.Name: Main Street
Room.Description: Except for the rats and the flies, this once busy part of the village is now deserted. The bodies that lie about here have one distinguishing feature-their throats are swollen and purple. You have to wonder what power created such a devastating plague. Two buildings lie to the east and west.

Exit.Description: You see the outskirts of the village.

Room.Name: A Small House
Room.Description: The stench of death clings to this dark house. The little light that peeks through the dark curtains falls on some crude furniture and rotting bodies. A small door leads west back onto the street.

Room.Name: Abandoned General Store
Room.Description: Although much of the stuff has been looted, a great deal of it remains on the shelves, as if the storekeeper had to leave suddenly. You do find that this place is pleasantly free of the death stench from outside, which is to the west.

Room.Name: The Outskirts of the Village
Room.Description: The number of houses along the road seem to be diminishing, along with the number of the dead. A sign at the end of town has been painted over with the words "All Dead Here". You can continue north or south.

Exit.Description: You see a long road lined with crosses.

Room.Name: A Long Road
Room.Description: You are stuck by the sheer magnitude of people who are crucified alongside the road here. Though it is not apparent why this has happened to them, it is obvious that some dark and evil force is at work in the land, dark as the malevolent black clouds that swirl and c onvulse overhead.

Room.Name: The Crossroads
Room.Description: You stand at the intersection of two major roads. To the north and east they continue into rolling plains. To the south you see a dark road, and west is a sheer cliff, atop which is a black fortress. You seem to remember from somewhere that crossroads are strange things, full of black magic and evil.

Exit.Description: You see a fortress in the distance.

Room.Name: A Road
Room.Description: This road winds through valleys and calm, grassy plains. It seems to lead to the dark forest to the north. You can return to civilization on the road south.

Room.Name: A Road
Room.Description: This road winds through valleys and calm, grassy plains. To the east you see an enormous gate cut from living rock. You can return to civilization on the road west.

Room.Name: The Tower
Room.Description: Crumbling brickwork surrounds you as you stand in the base of the tower. It seems that nature has been given run of the place, as mice scamper amid weeds and ivy. A delapidated wooden staircase leads upstairs, and a door leads south back outside.

Exit.Description: You see a clearing in the woods.

Room.Name: Laboratory
Room.Description: This laboratory is a wizards dream. It contains all manner of glassware, animal parts, rare herbs, and ancient tomes. A large table is covered with an extensive pipework of tubes, bowls, and spheres. An ancient, creaky stairway leads back to the base of the tower.

Room.Name: The Dark Road
Room.Description: Trees hang down low overhead. Stillness. Oppression. The sheer thickness of this darkness about you is stiffling. You can allow it to strangle you... or you can embrace it, wallow in it. You feel that, if that path i s one you choose, you will be quite welcome in the black, smokey castle which lies to the west.

NPC.name: doomsayer
NPC.description: He walks about the streets, spouting prophecies from a tattered holy book. His filty rags are covered with lice and fleas.
NPC.longDescription: A doomsayer wanders around, shouting about the end of the world.

NPC.name: beggar
NPC.description: He looks at you and and extends his flea-bitten arms.
NPC.longDescription: A beggar sits here, begging.

NPC.name: jed
NPC.description: Brother Jed, Bible in hand, is damning everyone to Hell. A group of university students mock and laugh at his foolishness.
NPC.longDescription: Brother Jed is here, ranting and raving.

NPC.name: guard
NPC.description: The guard keeps an eye out for lawbreakers, who will be punished swiftly and mercilessly.
NPC.longDescription: An Arkham Guard is here, enforcing the law.

NPC.name: sweeper
NPC.description: The street sweeper sweeps the streets, pocketing anything that looks useful.
NPC.longDescription: A street sweeper sweeps the streets.

NPC.name: hunter
NPC.description: The hunter flexes his burley muscles, making you reconsider attacking him.
NPC.longDescription: A hunter wanders through the woods.

NPC.name: rabbit
NPC.description: She stops to nibble on some grass, and then moves on.
NPC.longDescription: A rabbit hops along, unaware of your presence.

NPC.name: student
NPC.description: A student rushes past you in a flurry of papers, almost knocking over a professor.
NPC.longDescription: A university student rushes to class here.

NPC.name: professor
NPC.description: The professor scolds you for being late to class.
NPC.longDescription: A stern professor is standing here.

NPC.name: librarian
NPC.description: The librarian yells at you to shut up.
NPC.longDescription: A librarian is stamping books.

NPC.name: captain
NPC.description: Gishka K'ahn's rock-hard muscles are protected by a layer of thick, black platemail. He scowls at you, but doesn't leave his post.
NPC.longDescription: Gishka K'ahn, Captain of the Guard is here.
NPC.shortDescription: Gishka K'ahn, Captain of the Guard

NPC.name: warden
NPC.description: The warden paces back and forth, peeking in the patient's cells.
NPC.longDescription: A warden is here, checking on the inmates.

NPC.name: inmate
NPC.description: This raving lunatic also has Captain Trips, a deadly plague!
NPC.longDescription: An inmate is here, coughing and acting loony.

NPC.name: madman
NPC.description: This crazy keeps repeating "Ia, Ia! Shub-Niggurath!" over and over again.
NPC.longDescription: A madman is here, acting crazy.

NPC.name: salty
NPC.description: Old Salty, retired from sailing, has opened this bar and now lives through the tales of his seabound patrons.
NPC.longDescription: Old Salty, the tavern owner, is here wiping off the bar.

NPC.name: rogue
NPC.description: This cretin is going to shanghai you if you don't watch out.
NPC.longDescription: An ugly rogue lurks about, looking for a new crewmember.

NPC.name: spitfire
NPC.description: She looks at you, or, rather, your moneybag.
NPC.longDescription: Spitfire the pirate is here, examining her ship.

NPC.name: mapmaker
NPC.description: He seems too engrossed in his drawings to be of assistance to a customer.
NPC.longDescription: A mapmaker is drawing charts.

NPC.name: potter
NPC.description: She is obviously experienced, and her cups and pots are renowned throughout the world.
NPC.longDescription: Deborah, the potter, is making beautiful clay items.

NPC.name: innkeeper
NPC.description: Burl runs the Elder God's Inn, a favorite resting place for weary travellers.
NPC.longDescription: Burl, the inkeeper.

NPC.name: citizen
NPC.description: The citizen walks sluggishly down the gloomy cobbled streets.
NPC.longDescription: A citizen of Arkham looks depressed.

NPC.name: maid
NPC.description: Feather duster in hand, she rushes around dusting everthing in sight.
NPC.longDescription: A maid hurries about, cleaning rooms.

NPC.name: baker
NPC.description: Candi has a large sel ection of sweets, watch out if you're on a diet.
NPC.longDescription: Candi the baker is making cookies.

NPC.name: jack
NPC.description: Jack is one sick dude. Don't go near him.
NPC.longDescription: Jack is here, looking suspicious.

NPC.name: patch
NPC.description: Patch is entertaining, but watch your purse.
NPC.longDescription: Patch the barkeep is mixing drinks and telling tales.

NPC.name: thief
NPC.description: Yep, he's robbing you blind.
NPC.longDescription: A slimy thief is here trying to rob someone.

NPC.name: fence
NPC.description: Juko the fence is making a tidy profit from his fencing operation.
NPC.longDescription: Juko the fence is here, buying and selling.

NPC.name: pickpocket
NPC.description: Watch your coin purse around this young lad.
NPC.longDescription: A young pickpocket prowls the streets.

NPC.name: sylvia
NPC.description: Sylvia tries to interest you in going upstairs with her...
NPC.longDescription: Sylvia the call girl is turning tricks here.

NPC.name: peasant
NPC.description: She looks at you with sorrowful eyes, and then continues on her errands.
NPC.longDescription: A peasant walks about gloomily.

NPC.name: druggist
NPC.description: She carefully mixes ingredients and pours them into little jars. Many of the jars are for sale.
NPC.longDescription: A druggist is mixing potions here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Mage Warrior AssistVnum Shopkeeper

NPC.name: mage
NPC.description: This old, withered man is busy dusting off old wands or rearranging his scroll collection.
NPC.longDescription: Artemus the mage is selling magic items.

NPC.name: abbot
NPC.description: A balding, elderly man, the abbot looks over the papers on his desk, a troubled expression on his brow.
NPC.longDescription: Alain Corbert, the abbot of Arkham Monastery.

NPC.name: monk
NPC.description: A monk is here, reciting prayers to the Elder Gods.
NPC.longDescription: A monk is chanting here.

NPC.name: nun
NPC.description: A nun walks about here to attend the needs of the worshippers.
NPC.longDescription: A nun walks about burning incense here.

NPC.name: novice
NPC.description: This young novice is about to take his vows of service to the Elder Gods.
NPC.longDescription: A novice is here, learning how to be a cleric.

NPC.name: mummy
NPC.description: This was a cleric of great power, a saint whose body was mummified to preserve his greatness.
NPC.longDescription: A mummy of a dead saint rests here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Undead Cleric Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: skeleton
NPC.description: This skeleton has been given life by a magic user.
NPC.longDescription: A skeleton stumbles about here.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: member
NPC.description: This deranged person is performing ceremonies to revive an ancient demon.
NPC.longDescription: A cult member is chanting some perverse ritual.

NPC.name: priest
NPC.description: The evil priest is wearing flowing black and red robes. He is enraged that you have interrupted the ceremony.
NPC.longDescription: The evil High Priest is leading his flock in nasty ceremonies.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive Cleric Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: peasant
NPC.description: The peasant is carring heavy bags of produce to market.
NPC.longDescription: A peasant is toiling here.

NPC.name: housewife
NPC.description: She's avoiding the window, trying to hide from those pesky Jehovah's Witnesses.
NPC.longDescription: A housewife cleans the house here.

NPC.name: pilgrim
NPC.description: This pilgrim is here to visit the chapel at Arkham Monastery.
NPC.longDescription: A pilgrim is here, admiring Arkham.

NPC.name: ghost
NPC.description: The ghost is barely visible, yet it's attacks are quite real.
NPC.longDescription: A ghost floats about solemly.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Undead Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: alleycat
NPC.description: It's an old, grey and black striped cat. It has a nametag that reads "Pippin".
NPC.longDescription: An alleycat hisses at you.

NPC.name: mummy
NPC.description: This was a cleric of great power, a saint whose body was mummified to preserve his greatness.
NPC.longDescription: A mummy of a dead saint rests here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Undead Cleric Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: mummy
NPC.description: This was a cleric of great power, a saint whose body was mummified to preserve his greatness.
NPC.longDescription: A mummy of a dead saint rests here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Undead Cleric Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: cthul hu
NPC.description: This looks like a bulky 200 foot man with an octopus for a head.
NPC.longDescription: Cthulhu is here, weak and chained...he suddenly rises to attack you!
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive Cleric Mage Thief Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: elder
NPC.description: He's very large and ancient, commanding powers undreamed of by mortals.
NPC.longDescription: An Elder God is here, absorbed in his creation...he destroys you for disturbing him.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Aggressive Cleric Mage Thief Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: estelle
NPC.description: Estelle is a tall mercenary in battered red armor. She glares at you suspiciously.
NPC.longDescription: Estelle is sitting here, getting drunk.

NPC.name: quasimodo
NPC.description: Quasimodo is a large hunchback who is now deaf from ringing the bells all these years. His eyes bulge out at you expectantly.
NPC.longDescription: Quasimodo is here ringing bells and drooling.

NPC.name: fisherman
NPC.description: He glares at you, jealously guarding his favorite spot, even though he hasn't caught a thing all day.
NPC.longDescription: A fisherman is here, casting his line and pulling it back in again.

NPC.name: monster
NPC.description: He stands nearly seven feet tall. His greenish skin is patched together with thick stitches, and two metal knobs stick out on either side of his head.
NPC.longDescription: A vaguely human monster stands here.

NPC.name: necromancer
NPC.description: She looks about intently, and asks you directions to the nearest cemetary.
NPC.longDescription: A necromancer in dark robes wanders the streets.

NPC.name: mercenary captain
NPC.description: He is old and balding, but still a top-notch warrior.
NPC.longDescription: A mercenary captain sits at a desk, filing papers and assigning warriors.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior AssistVnum Shopkeeper

NPC.name: mage
NPC.description: She is young and full of talent.
NPC.longDescription: A mage is concentrating on spells here.

NPC.name: elf archer
NPC.description: He is tall and lithe, his long fingers delicately enfolding his bow. A large quiver of arrows is strapped to his back.
NPC.longDescription: An elven archer.

NPC.name: dwarf warrior
NPC.description: His stout, muscular frame is encased in thick plate armor, and his war hammer is held ready to bash in his opponents.
NPC.longDescription: A dwarven warrior.

NPC.name: stable-boy
NPC.description: He brushes down the horses and cleans their hooves. He inquires if he can be of service.
NPC.longDescription: A stable-boy lovingly grooms the horses in here.

NPC.name: rat
NPC.description: He has pure black skin and beady black eyes. His scaly hairless tail swishes back and forth.
NPC.longDescription: A rat is hiding here, nibbling on some corn.

NPC.name: weasel
NPC.description: She glares at you with something like hatred, like there is more to her than one could suspect...
NPC.longDescription: A weasel slinks in the shadows.

NPC.name: scarecrow
NPC.description: He seems to be jittering about animatedly. It could be the wind, or it could be something much darker.
NPC.longDescription: A scarecrow stands guard over the corn.

NPC.name: crow
NPC.description: This crow seems happy to find all this fresh, sweet corn unguarded.
NPC.longDescription: A crow caws out to the wind.

NPC.name: owl
NPC.description: She seems to swoop down at you, but she dives past you and snatches a nearby mouse.
NPC.longDescription: An owl flutters through the trees.

NPC.name: deer
NPC.description: She stands, alert to your presence.
NPC.longDescription: A deer is feeding on some leaves.

NPC.name: merchant
NPC.description: He is very ancient and his long white beard reaches all the way to the ground. He pushes a rickety wooden cart through the streets.
NPC.longDescription: A wandering merchant pushes a cart along the street.
NPC.flags: NPC Scavenger StayArea Mage Warrior AssistVnum Shopkeeper

NPC.name: bear
NPC.description: She bumbles along looking for some fresh meat for her cubs.
NPC.longDescription: A bear lumbers through the forest.

NPC.name: wizard
NPC.description: Having disturbed his experiment, he is not terribly pleased by your presence. Watch out.
NPC.longDescription: A wizard glares at you angrily.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Mage Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: witch
NPC.description: She capers about with a berserk glare in her eyes, as her incantation reaches a fevered level.
NPC.longDescription: A witch dances wildly and chants a spell.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Cleric Warrior AssistVnum

NPC.name: wyrm
NPC.description: This 300 foot long dragon-like creature is still very young. It stirs a little, its black slimy scales contracting as it breathes. You can tell by its large fangs that it is capable of inflicting great misery.
NPC.longDescription: A wyrm slumbers here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior AssistAlign AssistVnum

NPC.name: blacksmith
NPC.description: She wipes a stray lock of hair from her sweaty brow as she pulls a hot iron ingot from a furnace. She regards you with a nod and goes back to her work.
NPC.longDescription: A blacksmith hammers a suit of armor.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Cleric Mage Warrior Shopkeeper

NPC.name: mercenary
NPC.description: He is old and covered with scars from head to toe, but he has grown rich during his career. He shouts at you to get out of his home.
NPC.longDescription: A retired mercenary is resting by the fire.

ExtraDescription.Description: The helm looks heavy and strong.

Item.Name: plate darkened
Item.LongDescription: A suit of darkened platemail rests here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is dark and heavy, but polished to a brilliant sheen.

Item.Name: leggings darkened
Item.LongDescription: A pair of darkened leggings lie here.

ExtraDescription.Description: They appear to be excellent armor, strong but incredibly light.
This sword is heavy but deadly.
It seems to be the cap of a very wise man.
This mace seems deadly accurate.

Item.Name: cake
Item.LongDescription: A chocolate cake lies uneaten here.

Item.Name: helm
Item.LongDescription: The helm of Kazzal-Bak lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This helm once belonged to a famous archer.

Item.Name: sleeves bolted steel
Item.LongDescription: A set of bolted steel sleeves rest here.

ExtraDescription.Description: They appear quite heavy.

Item.Name: plate bolted steel
Item.LongDescription: A bolted steel breastplate sits unused.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is covered with the dents and scratches of well used armor.

Item.Name: bracer bolted steel
Item.LongDescription: A bolted steel bracer lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It looks tough and durable.
A bringer of much sorrow to its wielder's enemies.

Item.Name: dagger
Item.LongDescription: A thief's dagger lies in the dirt here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It has the sigil of the thieves guild embossed on the hilt.
Its transparent batlike wings look as light as the wings of night.
Used in mapmaking, it is also a decent weapon.

Item.Name: cookie cutter
Item.LongDescription: A cookie cutter is covered with dough.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is shaped like a cute little werewolf.

Item.Name: straight razor
Item.LongDescription: A straight razor covered with blood is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Looks like something a psycho killer would use.

Item.Name: thornblade dagger
Item.LongDescription: Thornblade rests here, light and elegant.

ExtraDescription.Description: Thornblade's pommel and hilt ends are shaped like red rose buds, and the grip is wrapped in green silk.

Item.Name: leather hotpants
Item.LongDescription: A pair of leather hotpants lie on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: They are bright pink and tacky looking.
Every part of this flail is made of the same bright silver metal.
This solid silver longsword is the standard issue to all pilgrims.

Item.Name: jar nectar
Item.LongDescription: A jar of nectar lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This jar looks like it hasn't been opened in eons.

Item.Name: golden ring
Item.LongDescription: A golden ring lies in the dust here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is carved with strange runes.

Item.Name: star amulet
Item.LongDescription: An amulet in the shape of a star is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: The star looks similar to the one worn by the monks and nuns at the abbey.
It looks incredibly heavy and evil.
It seems to be made of a cloudy, wispy material.

Item.Name: letter
Item.LongDescription: A letter lies here on the desk.

ExtraDescription.Description: "...and i can't sleep. I hear footsteps in the night and i get suspicious. Something strange is going on here and I can't put a finger on it. In my dreams I see a horrid goat-beast, with some of my own monks bowing down in praise to it."

We are looking for the culprit in a series of murders. The victims all had puncture wounds in their necks and drained completely of blood. It is suspected that a vampire is currently at large in our city. You assistance is appreciated.

This heavy book radiates pure evil. You read some of it-"And there is Cthulhu the massive, and the Elder Gods who are too bright to look upon. Shub-Niggurath, goat with a thousand young, is also waiting to retake claim upon all the lands..."

This poem seems to be the work of a sick mind. Though most of it is burnt, part of it is still legible.- "...sweet nectar for a thousand young. Give us strength, you who resides where the sun sets And we shall overtake Arkham like a storm from Hell"

Item.Name: vat blood
Item.LongDescription: A huge vat of blood sits in the middle of this room.

ExtraDescription.Description: The vat is full of partially congealed blood.
This fork has bloodstains on its two prongs.
This area was created by Lillith. Permission to use on any Merc mud is granted. 1994 (c)
The shield looks heavy and strong.
The bracer looks heavy and strong.

Item.Name: cap
Item.LongDescription: A cap made from a human skull.

ExtraDescription.Description: This cap is a brightly polished human skull with a small strap of leather inside to attatch it to the head.
You see a thin wand wrapped in multicolored ribbons.
The contents of this slim vial will help one flee from persuers.
This potion will make one ready for combat.
This corpse is of a young woman dressed in silver robes. She is completely white, save for two blood-red pierce marks on her neck.

Item.Name: fountain
Item.LongDescription: A large, ornate fountain is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A small white button with a green picture of Cthulhu smiling and waving.
A golden brown acoustic guitar with silver strings rests here.

Item.Name: chicken
Item.LongDescription: A plate of fried chicken sits on the table.

ExtraDescription.Description: It seems to have been cooked recently, and its rich aroma fills the air.

Item.Name: cowl
Item.LongDescription: A silver cowl lies crumpled on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: This silver cowl is covered with tiny red runes.

Item.Name: earrings
Item.LongDescription: A pair of jewel-encrusted earrings rest on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: They glow with a faint magical aura.

Item.Name: rosary
Item.LongDescription: A rosary made of silver beads lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Looking closer, you notice that each bead is carved with a tiny rune.

Item.Name: beer
Item.LongDescription: A bottle of beer sits here.

Item.Name: ale
Item.LongDescription: A large mug of dark ale.

Item.Name: whiskey
Item.LongDescription: A shot of whiskey sits on a table here.

Item.Name: slime
Item.ShortDescription: a shot of slime mold juice
Item.LongDescription: A shot of slime mold juice sits on a table here.

Item.Name: Blasphemy two-handed sword
Item.LongDescription: A two-handed sword with the word "Blasphemy" engraved on the blade.
Item.ExtraFlags: Dark Evil Magic Frost Sharp TwoHands Poison Unholy

Item.Name: chair
Item.LongDescription: A big comfortable arm-chair is standing here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This is a big wooden arm-chair covered in white fur rug.

Item.Name: bed
Item.LongDescription: A big wooden bed is waiting here.
